data.name: index_eversion
data.value: Failed to get the version from Configuration Engine command $1. The actual output from the command was : $2

data.name: index_eversion2
data.value: The Configuration Engine command $1 on your system is version $2, but this Webmin module only supports versions $3 .

data.name: index_rundesc
data.value: Click this button to run the command $1 on this host. All the actions listed above will be executed immediately, where necessary.

data.value: No configuration actions are currently defined.

data.name: run_desc
data.value: This page can be used to run the Configuration Engine on this host. When run, all the actions that you have configured will be carried out where necessary.

data.name: run_header
data.value: Options for running CFengine on this host

data.name: run_dry
data.value: Only show what would be done?

data.name: cfd_stopdesc
data.value: Click this button to stop the running Configuration Engine daemon. This will prevent other hosts from running the configuration on this server, and stop the scheduled running of the configuration.

data.name: cfd_startdesc
data.value: Click this button to start the Configuration Engine daemon with the settings above. This will allow other hosts to run the configuration on this server, and start the scheduled running of the configuration (if enabled).

data.name: cfd_none
data.value: No settings for the Configuration Engine daemon has been created yet.

data.name: push_pushdesc
data.value: Click this button to run the Configuration Engine on each of the hosts listed above, using the command $1. The local configuration from each host will be used for processing, unless you have arranged for the master configuration to be distributed to each host.

data.name: type_control_0
data.value: The field below lists the actions that are executed when the configuration engine runs, in the order that they will be executed. Actions which are not listed will not be processed, even if they are listed on the main page.

data.name: type_control_1
data.value: The options below control the global behaviour of the background process that accepts requests to execute the configuration on this host when requested by a remote host, or on a fixed schedule.

data.name: type_directories
data.value: The directories listed below will be created with the given ownership and permissions when they do not exist. The owner, group and permissions fields are optional.

data.name: type_links
data.value: The symbolic links listed below will be created where they do not currently exist. If a link already exists but points to a different destination, it will not normally be changed.

data.name: type_admit
data.value: The configuration engine daemon will only grant access to directory listed below by the hosts listed next to each directory. Hosts can be entered as an IP address, hostname or host pattern (like <tt>*.foo.com</tt>).

data.name: type_deny
data.value: Directories listed below will be denied access to by the hosts listed next to each directory, even if they are listed in an Allowed directories action. Hosts can be entered as an IP address, hostname or host pattern (like <tt>*.foo.com</tt>).

data.name: type_groups
data.value: Use the table below to define additional groups of hosts that can be used elsewhere in the configuration as class names. Groups can also contain shell commands in quotes that are executed to determine if the group evaluates to true or false.

data.name: type_copy
data.value: Each of the files or directories (and their contents) listed below will be copied to the chosen destination, when necessary. You can also choose to copy from a remote host, as long as that host is running the configuration engine daemon and allows this host to copy files.

data.name: type_disable
data.value: The files listed below will be checked to see if it exists and meets the selected size and type criteria, and if so disabled by either renaming or truncation.

data.name: type_editfiles
data.value: The text area below can be used to enter a script that edits the selected file, adding, deleting or updating lines where necessary. For the syntax of this script language, see the full CFengine documentation.

data.name: type_ignore
data.value: Any files or directories entered below will be ignored by all 'Copy files', 'Set permissions' and 'Tidy up directories' actions. Each entry can be a full path, a shell-style regular expression or a filename.

data.name: type_processes
data.value: Use the field below to search for processes matching the given pattern, and optionally send them a signal to kill them. When a process is killed, you can also specify a command to be run to restart it.

data.name: type_shellcommands
data.value: The commands listed below will be executed every time the configuration engine is run. The user and group fields are optional - if nothing is entered, the command will be executed as root. The timeout field is also optional - if no timeout is given, CFengine will wait forever until the command is complete.

data.name: type_tidy
data.value: The directories listed below will be scanned for files matching the selected name, age and time criteria each time CFengine is run. Any files found will be deleted, with no backup made.

data.name: type_miscmounts
data.value: NFS filesystem mounts listed below will be checked and mounted if necessary when CFengine is run. The NFS server and path field must be entered in the standard form of <tt>servername:/path/name</tt>. The mount options must be in the same format as used in the <tt>/etc/fstab</tt> file, and are optional.

data.name: type_resolve
data.value: The DNS server IP addresses that you enter below will be used to update the <tt>/etc/resolv.conf</tt> file when this action is run, by adding lines for any listed nameservers that are not yet in the file.

data.name: type_defaultroute
data.value: When this action is run, the configuration engine will check the current default route against the gateway specified below.

data.name: type_required
data.value: The filesystems listed below will be checked when this action is run to verify that they are mounted, and if not a warning message will be displayed. Each filesystem will also be checked to see if its free space has fallen below the set minimum, if any.

data.name: stop_err
data.value: Failed to stop Configuration Engine daemon

data.name: start_err
data.value: Failed to start Configuration Engine daemon

data.name: hosts_nohosts
data.value: No Webmin servers running CFengine have been defined yet.

data.name: hosts_rundesc
data.value: Click this button to have the Configuration Engine run on all the servers listed above, using their current configurations.

data.name: hosts_copydesc
data.value: Click this button to have the CFengine configuration from this server copied to all the servers above, and immediately executed.

data.name: add_echeck
data.value: Server $1 does not have the configuration engine module

data.name: add_ecfengine
data.value: CFengine is not installed on server $1

data.name: add_eversion
data.value: CFengine on server $1 is version $2, but this Webmin module only supports versions $3 .

data.name: cluster_header
data.value: Running configuration engine on all hosts in cluster ..
